label: 乾臨閣
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 2:  Heian Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1999
説明文: Building on the shores of the pond in the Park of the Divine Spring (Shinsen'en), where the emperor and his courtiers gathered for banqueting, archery exhibitions, flower and autumn-leaf viewing, music, dance, and poetry composition, or to escape the heat of a summer day (pp. 118-9). [神泉苑]
